page.title: 05CRODA INTERNATIONAL
page.content: The Snaith/Cowick area has strong ties with the chemical company Croda. The company whose early manufacture of lanoline was at Rawcliffe Bridge, moved its headquarters into Snaith in 1946. The building situated opposite St Lawrence Church was in fact the former Vicarage. The company experienced major growth in the post war period and in 1955 found itself short of accommodation. It came to the attention of the Board of Directors that the owner of the nearby Georgian Mansion, Cowick Hall, intended to demolish it but was being prevented from doing so by the Historic Buildings Council. The Hall, which had been a country seat of Viscount Downe, was used mainly for storage. The Directors were successful in negotiating a lease and consequently took possession of the Hall and park.
